name: InstaPy
description: InstaPy initializer

params.name: username
params.description: Instagram username

params.name: password
params.description: Instagram password

params.name: headless_browser
params.description: Headless browser, if true windows browser will not be shown

name: comment_by_locations
description: This method allows commenting by locations, without liking posts. To get locations follow instructions in 'Like by Locations'

name: follow_by_list
description: This will follow each account from a list of instagram nicknames

params.name: interact
params.description: It will use the configuration of set_user_interact setting

name: follow_by_locations
description: This method allows following by locations, without liking or commenting posts. To get locations follow instructions in 'Like by Locations'

name: follow_by_tags
description: Follow user based on hashtags (without liking the image)

params.name: tags
params.description: The tags that will be searched for and posts will be liked from

params.name: amount
params.description: The amount of posts that will be liked

params.name: skip_top_posts
params.description: Determines whether the first 9 top posts should be liked or not (default is True)

params.name: use_smart_hashtags
params.description: Make use of the smart hashtag feature

params.name: use_smart_location_hashtags
params.description: Make use of the smart location hashtag feature

params.name: randomize
params.description: Determines whether the first amount of posts should be liked or a random selection.

params.name: media
params.description: Determines which media should be liked, Photo or Video (default is None which is all)

params.name: interact
params.description: Defines whether the users of the given post should also be interacted with (needs set_user_interact to be also set)

name: follow_likers
description: This will follow the people those liked photos of given list of users

params.name: usernames
params.description: List of usernames

params.name: photos_grab_amount
params.description: It is how many photos will I grab from users profile and analyze who liked it

params.name: follow_likers_per_photo
params.description: The follow_likers_per_photo is how many people to follow per each photo

params.name: randomize
params.description: randomize=False will take photos from newes, true will take random from first 12

params.name: sleep_delay
params.description: It is used to define break time after some good following (averagely ~10 follows)

name: follow_user_followers
description: Follows the followers of each given user

params.name: usernames
params.description: List of usernames

params.name: amount
params.description: The amount is for each account

params.name: randomize
params.description: If randomize is false it will pick in a top-down fashion

name: follow_user_following
description: Follows the people that a given users are following

params.name: usernames
params.description: List of usernames

params.name: amount
params.description: The amount is for each account

params.name: randomize
params.description: If randomize is false it will pick in a top-down fashion

name: like_by_feed
description: This is used to perform likes on your own feeds

params.name: amount
params.description: It specifies how many total likes you want to perform

params.name: randomize
params.description: It randomly skips posts to be liked on your feed

params.name: unfollow
params.description: It unfollows the author of a post which was considered inappropriate

params.name: interact
params.description: It visits the author's profile page of a certain post and likes a given number of his pictures, then returns to feed

params.name: locations
params.description: You can find locations for the like_by_locations function by: browsing https://www.instagram.com/explore/locations/ or with a regular instagram search.

name: like_by_tags
description: Likes images per given tag

params.name: tags
params.description: The tags that will be searched for and posts will be liked from

params.name: amount
params.description: The amount of posts that will be liked

params.name: skip_top_posts
params.description: Determines whether the first 9 top posts should be liked or not (default is True)

params.name: use_smart_hashtags
params.description: Make use of the smart hashtag feature

params.name: use_smart_location_hashtags
params.description: Make use of the smart location hashtag feature

params.name: interact
params.description: Defines whether the users of the given post should also be interacted with (needs set_user_interact to be also set)

params.name: randomize
params.description: Determines whether the first amount of posts should be liked or a random selection.

params.name: media
params.description: Determines which media should be liked, Photo or Video (default is None which is all)

name: set_action_delays
description: After doing each action- like, comment, follow or unfollow, there is a sleep delay to provide smooth activity flow. But you can set a custom sleep delay for each action yourself by using the set_action_delays setting!

params.name: safety_match
params.description: Note: There is a minimum default delay for each action and if you enter a smaller time of delay than the default value, then it will pick the default value. You can turn that behaviour off with safety_match parameter.

name: set_blacklist
description: Controls your interactions by campaigns. ex. this week InstaPy will like and comment interacting by campaign called 'soccer', next time InstaPy runs, it will not interact again with users in blacklist. In general, this means that once we turn off the soccer_campaign again, InstaPy will have no track of the people it interacted with about soccer. This will help you target people only once but several times for different campaigns

params.name: campaign
params.description: Campaign name

name: set_comments
description: Changes the possible comments

params.name: comments
params.description: List of comments

params.name: media
params.description: Media type

name: set_delimit_commenting
description: This is used to check the number of existing comments a post has and if it either exceed the maximum value set OR does not pass the minimum value set then it will not comment on that post

params.name: max
params.description: It is the maximum number of comments to compare

params.name: min
params.description: It is the minimum number of comments to compare

params.name: comments_mandatory_words
params.description: This is used to check the description of the post and the first comment of the post (some users only put tags in the comments instead of the post description) for the occurence of mandatory words before commenting. If none of the mandatory words is present, the post will not be commented. This feature is helpful when you want to comment only on specific tags.

name: set_delimit_liking
description: This is used to check the number of existing likes a post has and if it either exceed the maximum value set OR does not pass the minimum value set then it will not like that post

params.name: max
params.description: It is the maximum number of likes to compare

params.name: min
params.description: It is the minimum number of likes to compare

name: set_do_comment
description: Defines if images should be commented or not.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Check if you want to enable it

params.name: percentage
params.description: Percentage of comments

name: set_do_follow
description: Defines if the user of the liked image should be followed

params.name: enabled
params.description: Check if you want to enable it

params.name: percentage
params.description: Percentage of follow

name: set_do_like
description: Set like feature. This method is only needed for the interact_by_... actions. Posts will liked by default when using like_by_... actions.

params.name: enabled
params.description: To enable do like

params.name: percentage
params.description: Percentage of post to like

name: set_dont_include
description: Defines which accounts should not be unfollowed, will prevent commenting on and unfollowing your good friends (the images will still be liked

params.name: friends
params.description: List of friends

name: set_dont_like
description: Changes the possible restriction tags, if one of this words is in the description, the image won't be liked but user still might be unfollowed

params.name: tags
params.description: '#exactmatch', '[startswith', ']endswith', 'broadmatch'

name: set_dont_unfollow_active_users
description: Prevents unfollow followers who have liked one of your latest n posts

name: set_ignore_if_contains
description: Ignores the don't likes if the description contains one of the given words

params.name: words
params.description: List of words

name: set_ignore_users
description: Changes the possible restriction to users, if a user who posts is one of these, the image won't be liked

params.name: users
params.description: List of users

name: set_mandatory_language
description: Restrict the description of the image to a character set

params.name: character_set
params.description: Available character sets: LATIN, GREEK, CYRILLIC, ARABIC, HEBREW, CJK, HANGUL, HIRAGANA, KATAKANA and THAI

name: set_mandatory_words
description: Searches the description, location and owner comments for words and will like the image if any of those words are in there

params.name: words
params.description: List of words

name: set_quota_supervisor
description: Take full control of the actions with the most sophisticated approaches

name: set_relationship_bounds
description: This is used to check the number of followers and/or following a user has and if these numbers either exceed the number set OR does not pass the number set OR if their ratio does not reach desired potency ratio then no further interaction happens

params.name: potency_ratio
params.description: It accepts values in 2 formats according to your style: positive & negative. Positive: potency_ratio == followers count / following count. Negative: potency_ratio == following count / followers count

params.name: delimit_by_numbers
params.description: It is used to activate & deactivate the usage of max & min values

params.name: max_followers
params.description: This is used to check number of followers of a user and skip if they aren't in the boundaries provided

params.name: max_following
params.description: This is used to check number of following of a user and skip if they aren't in the boundaries provided

params.name: min_followers
params.description: This is used to check number of followers of a user and skip if they aren't in the boundaries provided

params.name: min_following
params.description: This is used to check number of following of a user and skip if they aren't in the boundaries provided

params.name: min_posts
params.description: This is used to check number of posts of a user and skip if they aren't in the boundaries provided

params.name: max_posts
params.description: This is used to check number of posts of a user and skip if they aren't in the boundaries provided

name: set_simulation
description: During indirect data retrieval, simulation happens to provide a genuine activity flow triggered by a wise algorithm.

name: set_skip_users
description: This is used to skip users with certain condition. Default is skip private account

params.name: skip_private
params.description: Skip private account

params.name: private_percentage
params.description: You can set a percentage of skipping: private_percentage= 100 always skip private users private_percentage= 0 never skip private users

params.name: skip_no_profile_pic
params.description: Skip users that don't have profile picture

params.name: no_profile_pic_percentage
params.description: You can set a percentage of skipping: no_profile_pic_percentage= 100 always skip no profile pic users no_profile_pic_percentage= 0 never skip no profile pic percentage users

params.name: skip_business
params.description: Skip users that have business account

params.name: business_percentage
params.description: N.B.: This business_percentage parameter works only if no skip_business_categories or dont_skip_business_categories are provided!

name: set_smart_hashtags
description: Generate smart hashtags based on https://displaypurposes.com/ ranking, banned and spammy tags are filtered out.

params.name: tags
params.description: List of tags

params.name: limit
params.description: Defines amount limit of generated hashtags by hashtag

params.name: sort
params.description: Sort generated hashtag list 'top' and 'random' are available

params.name: log_tags
params.description: Shows generated hashtags before use it

name: set_smart_location_hashtags
description: Generate smart hashtags based on https://displaypurposes.com/map

params.name: locations
params.description: List of locations

params.name: limit
params.description: Defines amount limit of generated hashtags by hashtag

params.name: radius
params.description: Radius around the location in Miles

params.name: log_tags
params.description: Shows generated hashtags before use it
